group_1.narration: Faster than the white nebula of the goddess's sigh@could even dissipate,@from the record engraving its "new" singing voices@flowed a song of sorrow.
This was not the first time@she heard such sharp echoes,@like the silvery sparkle of stars@piercing the icy night of winter.
This record...@Sometimes it plays songs of painful screams.
This record is not the first to play songs of sadness,@however, as the goddess listens@to the singing voices for her first time,@she already knows just what brought them.
Though grief it may be, there is no despair...
The song is always the same.@A song of caged birds singing@with their gaze upon the blue sky.@A prayer to find hope and salvation.
This prayer...@Though the goddess be filled with unease and worry,@this prayer is her reason to not break this "special" record.
So long as this "special" record's prayers@break not the prayers of others,@she will watch over them.
Just as caged birds dream of freedom@to fly as they wish through the blue sky,@I too dream of a time where they can rejoice and play.
